terms.definition: A normative rule-set governing interpretation, conflict resolution, and system behavior across the ecosystem.
terms.scope_note: Use for the tiebreaker authority for interpretation and governance.

terms.definition: A stable platform identifier for a book listing on Amazon.
The authoritative record for titles, identifiers, links, keywords, and versioned metadata.
terms.scope_note: When metadata conflicts exist across sources, the Canonical Index wins.

terms.definition: Curated preferred terms and allowed variants used for stable indexing and retrieval.
terms.scope_note: This JSON is the machine-readable vocabulary registry.

terms.definition: Structured references connecting themes, motifs, and doctrinal patterns across books/volumes/series.
terms.scope_note: Nodes are passages/themes; edges use standardized link types.

terms.definition: Retrieval and organization layer intended to improve discoverability and structured access to the corpus.
Repository used to archive releases and mint DOIs for citation stability.
terms.scope_note: Mint DOI per release; prefer citing release snapshots.
